articles.title: The DailyJS JavaScript Developer Survey 2011

snippet.text: The popular DailyJS blog is running a JavaScript developer survey. It closes in a few days so fill it out now (it's only short). The statistics will shared later on and it'll be interesting to see how it pans out

articles.title: What Is Happening To The jQuery Plugins Site?

snippet.text: Last week, jQuery shuttered the popular jQuery plugins site, citing increasing levels of spam. Now, Adam J Sontag explains what the site's future is and how you, as a jQuery plugin creator, can help and be involved

articles.title: Announcing Amber.js: Yehuda Katz's New SproutCore-Inspired Framework

snippet.text: It's still early days, but Rails 3 and SproutCore veteran Yehuda Katz explains the motivation for his work on a new SproutCore-inspired JavaScript framework he's building called Amber.js

articles.title: Free HTML5 white paper from Sencha

snippet.text: we make application frameworks, tools, and cloud services that equip developers to create amazing app experiences using Web-standard technologies.(Powered by LaunchBit

articles.title: Introducing ECMAScript 5.1

snippet.text: ECMAScript 5.1 (or just ES5) is the latest revision of the ECMAScript standard - the specification that JavaScript is based on. In this article on the Opera dev site, Mike Taylor shows off some of the most useful changes and additions

articles.title: Extending JavaScript Natives

snippet.text: Angus Croll of Twitter demonstrates how you can extend native JavaScript objects and prototypes, why you might not want to, and a rationale for certain valid uses of the technique

articles.title: How to Get Gravatar Images from E-mail Addresses with JavaScript

snippet.text: Darcy Clarke presents the code and a video demonstration for grabbing user avatars (based on their e-mail address) from the popular Gravatar service

articles.title: Practical socket.io Benchmarking

snippet.text: Drew Harry presents some interesting analysis of the performance issues and ultimate message passing abilities of socket.io (a popular real-time data transport library written in JavaScript

articles.title: Node Modules You Should Know About: Optimist, an Options Parser
Introducing Mozilla's JavaScript Native File Management: OS.File

snippet.text: David Rajchenbach-Teller of Mozilla shows off a work-in-progress library being developed by Mozilla to offer native file manipulation and management from JavaScript

articles.title: New Book: Going Global with JavaScript and Globalize.js

snippet.text: There's no much information on internationalizing and localizing JavaScript apps out there, so it's interesting to see a book focused solely on the topic. The PDF sample looks good

articles.title: Backbone.js on Rails Screencasts: When Things Go Wrong

snippet.text: Joey Beninghove continues his run of commercial Backbone.js screencasts with the release of 'When Things Go Wrong', a screencast about handling validation errors coming from Rails and monitoring server availability

articles.title: The 50 Most Useful jQuery Plugins from 2011

snippet.text: All hail the list post. The SpeckyBoy blog rounds up 50 choice jQuery plugins with aplomb. Includes the usual screenshots for each choice and certainly worth a quick scan

articles.title: Circle Menu: A Circular Menu jQuery Plugin, Inspired by Path

snippet.text: Last week, many people were raving about the mobile interface for social network Path which includes a pop-out circular menu. Here's a jQuery copycat implementation by Jason Hutchinson

articles.title: Tubular: YouTube Background Player jQuery Plugin

snippet.text: Tubular is a jQuery plugin that lets you use a YouTube video as your page background. Just attach it to your BODY tag, specify a YouTube video ID and tell it the ID of your content wrapper

articles.title: FlodJS: A Tracker Music Player in JavaScript

snippet.text: In the late 80s and 90s, it was popular to create music using 'tracker' sequencers. FlodJS is an attempt to produce a JavaScript based player for files produced using trackers such as SoundTracker, FastTracker and ProTracker. One for the nostalgia crowd

articles.title: Client-Side JavaScript Audio Waveform Visualizer (warning: automatic audio)
Shred: An HTTP Client Library for Node.js
Logme: A Minimalistic Logger for Node.js

snippet.text: Logme is a lightweight 'logger' for Node.js that can deal with multiple logging levels (error, warning, debug, info, etc), provides color-coded output, and which is easy to customize. It's by Veselin Todorov

articles.title: CoffeeLint: A Code Linter for CoffeeScript
nanoScroller.js: jQuery Plugin for Lion-Styled Scrollbars
Read: Reading from Standard Input in Node
Elm: New Type-Safe Functional Language, Compiles to JS

snippet.text: Elm is a type-safe functional language that compiles to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It's also Evan Czaplicki's senior thesis ;-) It's certainly an interesting experiment and there are lots of examples
